Satakosia Tiger Reserve, Satakosia

Visited on September 29th,2019
Forest

Satkosia Tiger Reserve comprises of two adjoining Sanctuaries of central Odisha named as Satkosia Gorge Sanctuary and Baisipalli Sanctuary. These two sanctuaries together covering an area of 963.87 sq.km. have been notified as Satkosia Tiger Reserve.


The geographical co-ordinates of the extreme points of the Tiger Reserve boundary lie on 20 23’ 40” N and 20 45’ 36” N latitudes and 84º 32’ 35” E and 85º 05’ 24” E Longitudes Biogeopgraphically, the Tiger Reserve comes under Gadjat hills sub – division of 6B Chhotnagpur Plateau Biotic Provinces and 6C Eastern ghats Biotic Provinces under 6 – Deccan Peninsular Biogeographic zone. Virtually Satkosia Tiger Reserve represents the endemic life forms of both biotic provinces in the transitional zone.
